attributes.title: Choose the correct Qstream to run
attributes.content:
There are a few reasons why a 15-question Classic Qstream is the best recommendation in this case but the most important reason is that it aligns well with the client's main objectives which are:

  • Reinforcement
  • Long Term Retention
  • 3-month window of opportunity

The client's priorities appear to be reinforcement and long term retention with no sense of urgency to launch or complete the Qstream in a short time-frame since their product isn't set to launch for 3-6 months. These objectives align perfectly with the Classic Qstream settings.

The best recommendation would be to use 15 of the most critical and relevant questions for a Classic Qstream that would run for approximately 8 weeks.

NOTE: If the client feels strongly about using all 30 questions, our recommendation would be to split the 30 questions into two Classic Qstreams and run one after the other with a reasonable break (2-3 weeks) in between.

We've found that engagement and completion rates tend to slow down or drop off when a Qstream runs for more than 8 weeks. Therefore, we'd advise against a 30 question Classic Qstream in this case (even with adjusted repeat settings), as the duration would be approximately 12 weeks.

Pharma customers tend to tolerate / prefer longer-lasting Qstreams as opposed to customers in the Financial Services and Technology verticals.

choices.content: Run a Classic Qstream with all 30 questions but adjust the repeat settings so that incorrectly answered questions repeat in 5 days and correctly answered questions repeat in 9 days.
Run a Classic Qstream with only 15 of the 30 questions using standard spacing settings.
Run a Turbo Qstream with all 30 questions to shorten the duration of the Qstream.
Run a Turbo Qstream with 15 questions since the data shows that our European client-base pefers shorter Qstreams.
